item.title: Mount Si vs. Lake Washington 3/18/10
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Redmond's controlled offense wore down the aggressive Mount Si defense en route to a 18-0 victory. Mount Si kept it close in the first quarter trailing 3-0. After that, Redmond's experienced crew took advantage of the brand new Mt. Si squad and never looked back. Key performers for Redmond were Mernaugh, Downey, Aebi and Champagne with 3 goals each and Signoretty with 12 ground balls. Henry Owens picked up 7 ground balls for Mt. Si and goalie Will Dodeward netted 7 saves.

item.title: Mount Si vs. Sammamish 3/16/10
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Mount Si Lacrosse played it's first ever home game against Sammamish on March 16th at Snoqualmie Middle School. The veteran Sammamish squad controlled the game from start to finish and won 13-0. Mount Si's young crew played tough the entire game never giving up and playing every ground ball like it was their last. Beau Bachand had 6 ground balls for Mount Si.
Mount Si has 1 junior, 3 sophomores and 13 freshman on their young squad. Only 4 of them had ever played lacrosse before this season. Look for more spirited play and continued improvement from Mount Si Lacrosse as the season rolls on.

item.title: Mount Si vs. Redmond 3/25/10
item.dc:creator: coach
item.content:encoded:
Mount Si's third straight home game ended in similar fashion as the first two with a 18-0 loss to visiting Redmond. The young Mount Si squad has faced their 3 toughest in conference opponents in their first three games. Welcome to the league boys!! Mount Si again put together a strong first quarter but the experience and depth of Redmond wore them down. Mount Si was down to 12 players with 4 injuries and 1 player without enough practices.
Redmond was led by the 3 goals each from Joseph Mernaugh, Casey Downey, Quinn Aebi and Tanner Champagne who also collected 5 ground balls. Redmond defender Clement Signoretty had 8 ground balls. Mount Si was led by Beau Bachand with 9 ground balls and goalie Will Dodeward's 8 saves.

item.title: Mount Si vs. South Kitsap 3/27/10
item.dc:creator: coach
item.content:encoded:
Mount Si traveled to Port Orchard on Saturday and turned in their best performance of the season despite losing 11-4. It was close at the half with Mount Si trailing only 5-4. Two key second half injuries took the wind out of Mount Si as attacker Blake Moorhead left the game with a hand injury and midfielder Dane Dahline left due to an injured back. Those injuries limited Mount Si offensively and they just couldn't keep pace.
David Gibson led South Kitsap with 5 goals. Mount Si was led by two goals each from captain Matt Mahrer and Henry Owens. Mahrer also assisted on one of Owens' goals. Owens also had 7 ground balls as did Beau Bachand. Dahline had 4 ground balls before the injury. Goalie Will Dodeward had 8 saves.

item.title: Mount Si vs. Sammamish 3/31/10
item.dc:creator: coach
item.content:encoded:
Mount Si's last game before their spring break was a tough one. With only 11 players in uniform due to injury and absences Mount Si was just no match for Sammamish as they prevailed 17-1. It was an improvement over the first meeting with Sammamish when Mount Si was shut out. Mount Si's Matt Mahrer made sure that didn't happen with a second quarter shot to the back of the net. Mount Si's next game is at home vs. Liberty on April 14th.
Other top performers for Mount Si were Henry Owens with 6 ground balls and Brendan Pike with 4. Sammamish was paced by the 4 goals from Andrew Wenzel and 3 goals each from Tyvan Schmidt, Brian Headland and Sean Sternberg. Sam Chapman had 5 ground balls for Sammamish.

item.title: Spring Break Practices
item.dc:creator: coach
item.content:encoded: We'll be at Si View Park from 5-7 Monday through Thursday and Friday from 4-6. Attendance for this is voluntary but plan to attend if you're in town. We'll be working on our skills and assisting with the youth program. Hope to see everyone there that can be there.

item.title: Mt Si vs. Liberty 4/14/10
item.dc:creator: coach
item.content:encoded: Mount Si came so very close to winning its first game ever but came up short by one goal. Blake Moorhead had an outstanding day scoring four goals. He had two more that just missed. One glanced off the tip of a defenders stick and one came about a half second short as time expired in the third quarter. Matt Mahrer also had a great day offensively for Mt. Si scoring two goals, getting an assist and picking up four ground balls. Beau Bachand continued to be a force with 13 ground balls. New goalie Matt Yan had 9 saves.

item.title: Mt. Si @ Gig Harbor 4/17/10
item.dc:creator: coach
item.content:encoded:
Mount Si traveled to Peninsula High School on Saturday to take on Gig Harbor Lacrosse in a torrential downpour of rain in which Gig Harbor prevailed 11-4. The game was a little sloppy due to the rain and except for a letdown defensively by Mount Si in the second quarter it was a close contest. "We have to learn to play a full 48 minutes" said Coach Kiser. "That second quarter really killed our chance at getting a win." Mt. Si's offense was also down as Blake Moorhead, who had 4 goals the previous game was sidelined with an injury. Mount Si did a good job on Gig Harbor's star freshman Cody Olson holding him to 3 goals but other Gig Harbor players picked up the slack to get them the win. Kiser also praised the defense of Tom Evans. "Tom was very aggressive today and must have met at least 6 shots in mid air."
Mount Si was led in offense by the two goals of Henry Owens who also picked up 7 ground balls. Brendan Pike had a goal and 5 ground balls, Tucker Dana 1 goal, Matt Mahrer 1 assist, 4 ground balls, and Beau Bachand had 6 ground balls. Matt Yan had 11 saves.

item.title: Mount Si @ Redmond 4/20/10
item.dc:creator: coach
item.content:encoded:
In the second meeting between Redmond Lacrosse and Mount Si Lacrosse, Redmond again dominated in route to a 15-0 victory on their home field. Mount Si battled hard as they always do but Redmond's older and more experienced team controlled the ball on offense and played stifling defense. Top performers for Mount Si were Beau Bachand with 6 ground balls and Cameron Pike with 5. Nathan Whited was a beast on defense with several big hits while defending the crease for Mount Si.
Mount Si also played without their goalie Matt Yan who was suffering from the flu. Team Captain Matt Mahrer and defensive captain Tom Evans stepped in goal in Yan's absence. Both had played goalie before but not in any games this season. "That's what leaders do. They stand in the gap when no one else can" said Coach Kiser. " I was really proud of them tonight. It was a really difficult situation and they did as well as can be expected."

item.title: Mount Si @ Lake Washington 4/22/10
item.dc:creator: coach
item.content:encoded: Mount Si head coach Woodroe Kiser had two goals for his team in their match against division II powerhouse Lake Washington: Score 2-3 goals and keep them from scoring more than 12 goals. They made good on one scoring three times but Lake Washington prevailed 13-3. "The boys just keep getting better and that's all you can ask from a first year program" said Kiser. Matt Mahrer paced Mount Si with 2 goals and Cameron Pike added the other as well as getting an assist and 4 ground balls. Face off specialist Beau Bachand grabbed another 5 ground balls. Bachand is second in the conference in ground balls and 18th overall in division II play. Henry Owens added an assist and 5 ground balls. Owens is fourth overall in the conference for ground balls. Goalie Matt Yan again played well snatching 6 saves. Cody Bernstein led Lake Washington with 2 goals and 3 assists.

item.title: Mount Si Girls Lacrosse?
item.dc:creator: coach
item.content:encoded: Questions have surfaced about a possible girls lacrosse team in the Snoqualmie area. If there is enough interest then we could definitely have a program for the girls as well. If anyone is interested in getting a program up and running please contact us so we can get started on promoting this for next year.

item.title: Two on All-Conference Team
item.dc:creator: coach
item.content:encoded:
Henry Owens and Beau Bachand have been named to the All-Conference team for the Evergreen Conference in Division II High School Boys Lacrosse for 2010.
Both Owens and Bachand play midfield and were among the leaders in ground balls for the conference. Owens was also an offensive threat from his midfield position. Bachand was tenacious at face offs winning those battles at a high percentage.
Both are new to lacrosse and are both underclassmen. Owens is a sophomore and Bachand is a freshman. Look for more big things from them in the next few years.

item.title: Wednesday Night Wall Ball!
item.dc:creator: coach
item.content:encoded:
Wednesday Night Wall Ball begins this Wednesday June 30th at Snoqualmie Middle School from 5pm to 6pm.
All age levels for boys and girls. Bring your friends!!!
This is a great opportunity to improve skill and to try it if you've never experienced lacrosse before.

item.title: Box Lacrosse!!
item.dc:creator: coach

This opportunity is open to 5th graders through high school. 5th grade through 8th grade will be more of an instructional setting while the high school players will play in a league. $250 for 5th through 8th grade and $150 for high school. 8 weeks of great lacrosse! Instructors will feature Stealth players Lewis Ratcliff, Jason Bloom, Chris O'Dougherty, and head coach Chris Hall. It will take place at Arena Sports in Woodinville. Follow the link below to register. http://www.walax.com/?q=box_lacrosse_seattle_field_players_here

item.title: Youth and High School Programs Now Combined
item.dc:creator: coach
item.content:encoded: A big welcome to the youth players and parents to the official site of Mt. Si Lacrosse! The youth program that operated as Snoqualmie Valley Youth Lacrosse last year is now combined with the high school program under one name-Mt. Si Lacrosse Club. Not much really changes except our name and that we are operating as a single unit with common goals. Please check in frequently or subscribe to our RSS feed to keep up with all the latest developments with our club. The latest news is that we are moving forward with girls lacrosse for this coming spring of 2011.

Teams will fill up fast and we need you to register now so that we can plan for rosters, schedules, fields and coaches. All registration is managed online through our secure online registration program.

item.title: High School Boys Get First Win!
item.dc:creator: coach
item.content:encoded:
Mt. Si downs Port Angeles for first boys lacrosse win NORTH BEND After finishing 2010 without a win and dropping their first two this season, Mt. Si recorded the first win in their two-year history with a 5 3 boys Division II high school lacrosse win over Port Angeles, Saturday at Mt. Si High School. Taking an early 4 2 lead at the half, Mt. Si. Continued to put defensive pressure on PA throughout the second half to seal the win. We moved to a zone and shortened up our slides, said Mt. Si head coach Woodroe Kiser. Our defense was plain outstanding. We really limited PA to what they could do. Blake Moorhead delivered 2 goals and an assist, while Eli Gogan, Cameron Pike and Matt Mahrer all contributed solo shots in the win. Goaltender Matt Yan contributed 11 saves. Brendan Capenter, Jacob Dostie and Joey Hall all scored solo-shots and goaltender Julian Walls had 17 saves for PA. Julian (PA goaltender Walls) had a great game, said Kiser. We were getting great shots all night and he was stopping us. He was impressive tonight. With the loss, Port Angeles evened their record to 1-1 on the season.
SCORING HIGHLIGHTS: Mt. Si 5, Port Angeles 3 (Blake Moorhead, MS, 2 goals, 1 assist; Eli Gogan, MS, 1 goal; Cameron Pike, MS, 1 goal; Matt Mahrer, MS, 1 goal, 1 assist; Matt Yan, MS, 11 saves; Brendan Carpenter, PA, 1 goal; Jacob Dostie, PA, 1 goal; Joey Hall, PA, 1 goal; Julian Walls, PA, 17 saves)

item.title: Summer Lacrosse for Boys & Girls Grades 1-4
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Mount Si Lacrosse Club is excited to present an opportunity for boys & girls in the Snoqualmie Valley to develop the basic fundamentals of the game while learning the important strategies of lacrosse. This five week session will be hosted by Mount Si Lacrosse Club coaches and will take place at Si View Park. Participants do not need any equipment to come to this clinic! We will have sticks on hand for those who do not have their own gear yet. Come dressed to play outside and wear sneakers. This clinic will go fast so sign up quickly! Grades: 1-4 (in fall of 2011) Days: Wednesdays Dates: May 25 - June 29 Times: TBD Fee: $35 Click to register through SI VIEW PARKS

item.title: Sticks-2-Schools Fundraiser Oct. 16 at Tech City Bowl in Kirkland
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Last Spring, the Sticks-2-Schools program was introduced to Washington and visited schools in the Puget Soundregion, introducing students to the benefits of a healthy lifestyle. With over 80 schools on the waiting list for this great program, Sticks-2-Schools is teaming up with the Washington Stealth for a fundraiser at Tech City Bowl in Kirkland, Wash., on October 16 to introduce more children to lacrosse as a way to get active and stay fit. The Tech City Bowl fundraiser will help to provide more students in Washington the opportunity to learn about the benefits of a healthy lifestyle through lacrosse. Those in attendance will be treated to an afternoon of bowling, arcade games and snacks with numerous players from the Washington Stealth, as well as the Bombshells dance team and the Stealth mascot, Bomber the Fox. The event will be held from 1pm-3pm on Sunday, October 16. Tickets for the event are just $25 for adults and $15 for children under 13 years old. There will also be an auction including great prizes and Stealth memorabilia. All of the money raised during the event will go towards equipment, curriculum guides and instruction for local schools on the Sticks-2-Schools waiting list. Tech City Bowl is located at13033 NE 70th Place, Kirkland, WA 98033. To RSVP for the event, send an email to community@stealthlax.com, or call Sticks-2-Schools coordinator Breanna Kernan at (425) 322-2623. For more information on Sticks-2-Schools, visit www.sticks2schools.org

item.title: Fall Academy with the Washington Stealth
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: Fall Ball for Youth (2013)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
The Mount Si Lacrosse Club (MSLC), proud to carry on our young but growing tradition of lacrosse in the valley, is excited to participate in the 2013 Fall Lacrosse program offered by the Greater Eastside Lacrosse League (GELL) . Turnout at last years youth and high school Fall Lacrosse programs was great and this year is expected to be even better. Plus we have a RAFFLE! (see below). FOR WHO? For you! Fall Lacrosse is open to our current 7/8 program players and our incoming last springs 5/6 program players. In other words, all boys in 7/8 grade during the 2013-2014 school year are eligible and welcome. MSLC Fall Lacrosse is for beginning and returning players. MSLC Fall Lacrosse is for boys playing other sports that want to give lacrosse a try prior to the 2014 Spring Lacrosse Regular Season. MSLC Fall Lacrosse is super casual, with very few practices (see below), and it gives the kids a chance to keep improving their skills and confidence. MSLC Fall Lacrosse is a really great way for boys who have never played to get introduced to the sport before the Regular Spring Lacrosse season. Lastly, it doesn't conflict with football or other Fall sports because it all takes place on Sundays. Dont forget the Raffle (see below)! PRACTICE and GAME SCHEDULE Similar to other GELL youth programs participating in Fall Lacrosse, time commitment is minimal. Our Practice and Game schedule is every Sunday starting September 8th through mid-November. All practices and games (home and away) will be on Sunday (mostly late afternoon). Sunday practice/games are considered mandatory. One entirely optional mid-week practice will also be offered. Practices and Games generally take two hours. MSLC COACHING STAFF Team coaches will include Paul Riley and Jamie Lomas and other parents that have expressed interest in helping out. Most of the coaches have played collegiate or club lacrosse. All are huge proponents of Fall Lacrosse and the Raffle (keep reading). REGISTRATION!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!IMPORTANT! IMPORTANT! IMPORTANT! Registration goes live and registration starts Friday July 20th and closes September 4th. Here is the link to register
  • Registration will ask for and require active U.S. Lacrosse Membership
  • MSLC Fall Lacrosse requires a minimum of 14 boys (per team)
  • MSLC must declare a team(s) to GELL by August 17.
Registration Costs and Rental Gear Program (for new and beginning players) are given below. Hint: The Raffle Involves Registration (see below) COST By August 15: The cost/player is only $65 for Seniors and $75 for HS. Fee covers games, fields and referee costs. Rental gear (full package) is available (see below). RENTAL EQUIPMENT AVAILABLE New and slightly used full gear is available for rent on a first come first serve basis. Rental gear available includes all the required hardware ( lacrosse stick, gloves, helmet, arm pads, and shoulder pads) or as needed. Rental gear is reserved for first time players to introduce them to one of the fastest growing youth sports in the nation. RAFFLE MSLC Fall Lacrosse will raffle one top-of the-line stick or helmet to the Raffle Winner (players choice).
  • The helmet being raffled is as follows: Cascade Pro7, Red Shell, Silver Chin, Silver Visor (Mt Si colors).
  • The stick being raffled is as follows: Harrow Cross Bow with any Harrow shaft.
Rules: 1. Each player (new or old) that sponsors a NEW player will get a free raffle ticket. For example, if a player sponsors three new players, get three free raffle tickets. 2. A NEW player is defined as a player that has not played club lacrosse before AND is interested in participating in MSLC Fall Lacrosse program! 3. Raffle drawing will be held within one week of the close of Registration. 4. The new player must list the sponsors name on the Registration page during Registration. Please contact (whomever you want, to me is ok)..with any questions or comments. Help us make this a great Fall Lacrosse Program and to Honor the Game!

wp:comment.wp:comment_author: Amy
wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Do you have fall Lacrosse for 6th grade boys?

item.title: Call for Coaches
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Mount Si Lacrosse Club is already planning for the upcoming Spring lacrosse season. Please let us know if you or anyone else would like to be a Head Coach for the 2013 Spring Lacrosse Season. This year we plan to have our Head Coaches selected by October to allow sufficient time for preparation before the Spring season and participation in our Fall Clinics. We will be conducting interviews for Head Coach positions during the week of Oct 1st for the Boys Lightning (2nd-4th grade), Juniors (5th/6th grade), and Seniors (7th/8th grade) divisions. If you are interested in interviewing for one of the Head Coaching positions, please email Dennis Simmons or call 206-380-0736 for more details.

item.title: Play under the lights! 2 Fall Clinics Coming in October
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Here's your chance to play lacrosse under the lights!

Mount Si Lacrosse Club will be offering two Fall Lacrosse clinics on October 19 & 26 from 6-8 pm. These fun & casual clinics will provide current lacrosse players the opportunity to get their stick out and work on their skills as well as introduce new kids to the game. Youth and High School coaches from the Mount Si Lacrosse Club will be running the clinic. WHO: The clinic is for boys and girls from 2nd grade through 8th grade. WHEN: The sessions will be October 19 and 26 from 6 to 8pm. WHERE: On the turf and under the lights at Mount Si High School HOW MUCH: The clinic is FREE, but please register so we know you're coming! WHAT TO BRING: It is a "sticks only" clinic, so no special gear is needed. Don't have a stick? Don't worry!! Mount Si Lacrosse has sticks to use for those who do not have their own.

REGISTER TODAY!

item.title: 2013 Spring Registration Information
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Online registration will open on Sunday, November 18, 2012.

Important! "Early bird" pricing will apply ONLY on November 18 & 19. Be sure to register online before midnight on November 19 to receive the lowest registration fees of the season. Don't forget to join us at the Registration Rally! When: Sunday, Nov. 18 from 11 am to 3 pm Where: Mount Si High School Commons area Who: all ages, players, parents, families, and friends of Mount Si Lacrosse Club

What is the Registration Rally??? It's a party to celebrate the countdown to lacrosse season!

  • Try on uniforms for next season
  • Check out the latest lacrosse gear from Sports Authority & Harrow
  • Meet the coaches and ask questions
  • Preview new Mount Si Lacrosse spirit wear and preorder (GREAT Christmas gifts!)
  • See the MS Lax team bag and take one home with you! (on-hand quantity limited)
  • Get yourWashington Stealth season tickets
  • Delicious BBQ & drinks will be available for $5
  • Swap gear you don't need anymore for new gear in our 1st annual Lax Equipment Swap
  • Parents, learn about volunteer opportunities and sign up to help out

item.title: Sports Authority Shopping Event & Fundraiser
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This weekend only! November 17-20

At the Issaquah Sports Authority, get 20% off your entire purchase of ANYTHING, and earn 5% back for Mount Si Lacrosse. Click this image to open a printable version

item.title: Early Bird Online Registration Opens Sat Nov. 17
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
EARLY BIRD REGISTRATION,1 WEEK ONLY!

Register before midnight on Sunday Nov. 25 for the lowest registration fees of the year. NEED COST INFORMATION? Read the Registration FAQ before you start the process.
**Early birds get a FREE Mount Si Lacrosse logo t-shirt at the RALLY! ($20 value, only available at the rally)

Sunday, November 18, 11-3 pm

Mount Si HS Commons

GET INFO
  • Meet your 2013 Mount Si Lacrosse coaches & board of directors
  • Learn about this years tryout process for Seniors and High School
  • Explore & sign up for volunteer opportunities
GEAR UP
  • EQUIPMENT SWAP! Bring gently used equipment to sell, trade, or donate (drop off between 10-11 am)
  • Try out new gear from Sports Authority and try on your new 2013 uniform
  • Check out the latest sticks and lax gear from Harrow
  • Click for more details about the equipment swap
GET GIFTS
  • Get your Mount Si Lax team bag now! (limited supply on hand)
  • Youve got spirit! Get your new car decals and stadium seats
  • Preview the new 2013 Mount Si Lacrosse spirit gear from Cloud 9 Sports
GET TOGETHER
  • Find out how you can help with our 1st ever spring fundraising auction
  • Get your tickets for our Mount Si Lacrosse group nights on Jan. 5 and Feb 9, 2013
  • Meet the reps from the Stealth and get season tickets!
$5 BBQ, GAMES, PRIZES, & RAFFLE
  • Get 1 free raffle ticket just for coming to the rally, and for every friendyou bring, get an extra raffle ticket PLUS a free Mt Si lax water bottle!

item.title: Stealth Night & Launch-A-Ball
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Mount Si Lacrosse is hosting thepopular Launch-A-Ball fundraiserat the first Stealth game of the 2013 season on Saturday, January 5. We have a section of 100 seats reserved for the game this evening so we can all sit together and cheer on the Stealth! Ticket sales through Mount Si Lacrosse is now closed, but you can still get tickets at the door and come to the game! Launch-A-Ball (LAB) is one of the Stealths major fundraisers that happens every home game. How does LAB work? LAB is a contest that allows Stealth fans to test their throwing skills and accuracy. At halftime, fans will throw tennis balls from the stands onto the playing surface in an attempt to be the closest to hit certain targets and the center circle on the turf. The fans who are lucky enough to hit the prize targets by getting their tennis balls inside a tire, will receive that prize. The fan that is closest to the center of the field will receive a cash prize. ($100 cash).

item.title: Dec 19-21: Sammamish Lacrosse Showcase at Eastside Catholic
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: Registration Update & Important Announcements
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Registration is now closed.

If you are still interested in registering for lacrosse this year, please contact us! Send an email toadmin@mountsilacrosse.org

Scholarships are still available, even if you have already registered!

See the financial aid page for more information about how to apply. We have received generous assistance from donors who have designated their funds to be used only to help with player fees.

item.title: Lax Speed Camp Starts January 28
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
WHEN: Mondays and Wednesdays for 4 weeksbeginning January 28, 4:30 to 5:30 pm. WHERE: Mount Si High School Track WHO: Open to boys in grades 7 through 12 whoare registered to play lacrosse this season. COACHES: Tony Manjarrez & Ja'Warren Hooker COST: $100 for 8 sessions. Includes t-shirt. click toSIGN UP NOW No lacrosse experience necessary! Why Amplify Speed Clinic? Competing in today's sports arena requires much more than attendance and participation. To compete for certain positions or playing time, an athlete needs to be better than those around him or her. Amplify directors are committed to working with athletes through a variety of instructional settings to amplify their ability through speed, strength, and agility training. At Amplify Speed Clinic, you will gain:
  • Improved running form
  • Explosive acceleration
  • Improved agility and change of direction
  • Increased speed
  • Core strength development
  • Increased flexibility and range of motion
  • Increased athleticism
  • Nutritional coaching

item.title: Box Lacrosse Bash & Stealth Game on Feb. 9
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
• Download the Box Bash parent/player info pdf
If you played last year and are registered to play on the Lightning, Juniors, or Seniors teams this season, get ready to play on the turf where the Stealth play on Saturday, Feb. 9!
  • Every player and parent attending the scrimmage needs to have their own ticket for the Stealth game later that evening.
  • Beginning at 12 pm, our two clubs will play 2 short games at each of the three youth levels (grades 2-4, 5-6, 7-8)
  • If you didn't play lacrosse last year, you are still invited to come watch the scrimmages and hang out with your team at the Stealth game. Everyone is welcome!!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: [...] Any player who played last year and is registered to play this year is eligible for this exciting game on the turf at Comcast Arena. Tickets are $20. Everyone must have a ticket to the Stealth game that evening. Click for more info. [...]

item.title: Mandatory Parent Meeting for Boys Lightning, Juniors, and Seniors
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
WHEN: Wednesday, January 30th, 2013 WHERE: Snoqualmie Middle School Commons TIMES: 6:00 - 7:00 PM Boys Lightning (Grades 4 & under) 7:00 - 8:00 PM Boys Juniors (Grades 5 & 6) 8:00 - 9:00 PM Boys Seniors (Grades 7 & 8) IMPORTANT! Please bring your child's completed concussion form to the meeting. This is required before they can even step on the field to play. No exceptions. Download & print form here. At this meeting, we will provide information and answer questions regarding the 2013 season, introduce your coaches and managers, announce the schedule for practices and games, and discuss our team expectations, philosophy, and goals.

More announcements & upcoming events

Financial Aid is still available We have received generous assistance from donors who have designated their funds to be used only to help with player fees. If you are aware of any kids who are not yet registered for financial reasons, please encourage them to apply for financial aid. Already registered? Its ok, you can still apply for aid too. Application is on the website, on the Financial Aid page. Feb. 9: Box Lax Bash! before the Stealth game 12:00 to 4:00, Scrimmages for all youth levels against Bellingham (Whatcom). Any player who played last year and is registered to play this year is eligible for this exciting game on the turf at Comcast Arena. Tickets are $20. Everyone must have a ticket to the Stealth game that evening. Click for more info. March 23: Our 1st annual fundraising auction. Old folks only!! We need your help! Please bring any items you can contribute to be auctioned off to the parents meeting on Jan. 30th even just a bottle of wine will go into a basket of items for the auction. Get your tickets fast, space is limited! Each team will be sponsoring a basket auction. Lightning will have a "Game Night" themed basket, Juniors will have a "Chocolate Lovers" themed basket, and Seniors will have a coffee themed basket. If you can bring a donation for your team basket to the parent meeting it would be very much appreciated. Click for more info

item.title: Fall Ball Registration is NOW OPEN!
item.dc:creator: devlin
item.content:encoded:
Fall Ball Registration is now open for 7/8th grade boys and High School players.
Fall Ball is a relaxed and fun way to keep a player's Lacrosse skills sharp during the off season.
In Fall Ball the main focus is on Lacrosse fundamentals.
The commitment is once a week on Sundays.
The format for Seniors is games against other teams in the league, with occasional Sundays of practice only.
For all other High School players it will be games only on Sunday, no practices.
Fees: $65 for Seniors, $75 for HS.
Please be mindful of the deadline for registration - September 4th!!

The 2013-14 Lacrosse Season Registration rally will be held November 10<sup>th,</sup> from 10:00am through 2pm this year at Mount Si High School. The event will take place in the commons area. On the menu will be pulled pork sandwiches, chips and a beverage for $5. This is an excellent time to meet with coaches and other lacrosse families, check out the new spirit wear, and get your questions answered. For those attending the registration rally and registering for the 2014 season, a free Lacrosse tee shirt will be given. <ul> <li><b>Early Bird Registration</b> for the regular season all levels will open on Sunday, November 3rd, 2013. Early bird discounts end at 11:59 pm on Sunday, November 10th, 2013. Early registrants will receive $15 off the regular price.</li> </ul> <ul style="margin-top: 0in;" type="disc"> <li class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in;"><b><span style="mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman';">Regular Registration</span></b><span style="mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman';"><span style="mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman';"> continues from November 10th through 11:59 pm on Sunday, January 12<sup>th</sup>, 2014.</span></span></li> <li class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in;"><b><span style="mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman';">Late Registration</span></b><span style="mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman';"> runs from January 13, 2014 to February 16, 2014. The Late registration fee is $35.</span></li> </ul> <b><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 115%; font-family: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; mso-ascii-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-hansi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-bidi; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA;">Scholarship </span></b><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 115%; font-family: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; mso-ascii-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-hansi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-bidi; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">information can be obtained by email to </span><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 115%; font-family: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; mso-ascii-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-hansi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-bidi; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA;"><a href="mailto:admin@mountsilacrosse.org">admin@mountsilacrosse.org</a>.</span>

item.title: Mount Si Lacrosse Club is very pleased to announce Mr. Chris Castleberry as the new Varsity Head Coach.
item.dc:creator: devlin
item.content:encoded: Along with this announcement please mark your calendars as there is an all high school meeting on October 17th at 2:30PM at the Freshman Campus Library. All players can meet Coach Castleberry and learn more about his coaching philosophy and his expectations for the coming year. Attendance is expected for all new and returning players. For players in football or with other conflicts,you will haveanopportunityduring the Registration Rally November 10th to meet with Coach Castleberry. Please read on to learn more about Coach Castleberry: My lacrosse career began in Port Angeles, where I helped start the program, win a D2 State Championship with an undefeated season, and propel our program to the D1 level of play. While at Port Angeles I excelled as a goalie by both being named team captain and earning individual honors as team defensive most valuable player, and playing on the State All-star team. During my senior year I answered the call to duty and joined the United States Marine Corps immediately following the terrorist attacks on September 11th. While in the Marine Corps I continued to play lacrosse, both at home, and abroad while deployed overseas. After playing in a joint service All-Star team throughout Asia, I started the Marine Corps' first ever Varsity lacrosse team. I played the role of captain / coach and entered our team in competitive post collegiate mens leagues and tournaments, such as the Hawaii Lacrosse Invitational, and the Jam by the Sea tournament in San Diego. While playing defense for my Marine Corps Lacrosse team I was scouted by the University of San Diego (USD), where I would continue my playing career from 2010-2012. I switched back to goalie and led the nation in saves and won MVP honors in post-season tournament play against that years national champion contenders. After my first year playing for USD I was the only new player to be named as team captain, and was also voted to the student board of directors. Due to injuries sustained while in the Marine Corps, I had to end my collegiate playing career early, but would continue my involvement in the sport as a coach. I started my coaching career in 2004 as head coach of the Rancho Bernardo Middle School team in San Diego. After a successful first season coaching middle school, I was asked to move up to the high school level, where I would be named the head lacrosse coach of a Varsity program at the age of 22, which was the youngest age for any head varsity lacrosse coach in San Diego. I coached at Mount Carmel High School for three seasons, where I prided myself on my offseason involvement with the program. Our team participated in numerous summer, fall, and winter leagues, as well as conditioning and team building camps that I started. Off-season development is something I strongly suggest for a successful program, which is why I coached at several camps and clinics, and led my team, and Starz elite teams to offseason tournament honors. My most recent coaching experience was during my senior year this past spring, where I volunteered my time as the assistant coach and defensive coordinator for Helix Charter HS. I helped lead a developing urban program to its first post-season appearance, with a team that had more first time players than returning players. Lacrosse continues to be a major part of my life, and is so much more than just a sport to me. As a Snoqualmie Tribal Member, I take pride in being able to have played, and continue to coach "The Creators Game". I learned early on in my coaching career by an influential mentor, Dennis Yeatman, how coaching lacrosse is more than X's and O's; it's about building lasting relationships, teaching respect for the game, our opponents, and to everyone that has helped endure our game over the centuries. I am grateful to be afforded the opportunity to coach for Mount Si, and feel that I have been given the coaching opportunity of a lifetime. For such a young program, Mount Si is head and shoulders above any other 5th year program. By providing our young athletes the opportunity to play the game, it will surely prove beneficial in creating a winning and lasting program, a program that I am truly thankful and excited to be a part of. Thank you for entrusting the future of Mount Si Lacrosse upon me, and I promise to lead the team with integrity and respect for my athletes and the Creators Game alike. Yours, Coach Chris

item.title: Washington State Prep Lacrosse features story on Mt. Si's new HS Varsity Coach - Chris Castleberry!
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded:
More than a game: Lacrosse champion, former Marine Chris Castleberry delivers life lessons at Mount Si.
OCTOBER 24, 2013
SNOQUALMIE, Wash. When you think about high school sports and their role in the lives of young people; instilling the importance of teamwork, respect, work ethic and a sense of contributing to something bigger than self all come to mind.
To read more on this story, please visit: http://www.washingtonhslax.com/2013/10/24/game-lacrosse-champion-former-marine-chris-castleberry-delivers-life-lessons-mount-si/

item.title: Fall Lacrosse Clinics & Registration Rally
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded:
Here's your chance to play lacrosse under the lights!

Mount Si Lacrosse Club will be offeringtwo 2013Fall Lacrosse clinics in November! These will provide current lacrosse players the opportunity to get their stick out and work on their skills as well as introduce new kids to the game. Youth and High School coaches from the Mount Si Lacrosse Club will be running the clinic. WHO:The clinic is for boys and girls from 2nd grade through 8th grade. WHEN:The sessions will be November 10, 2013 from 3pm - 5pm and November 17, 2013 from 5:30pm to 7:00pm. WHERE:On the turf and under the lights at Mount Si High School HOW MUCH:The clinic is FREE, but please register so we know you're coming! WHAT TO BRING:It is a "sticks only" clinic, so no special gear is needed. Don't have a stick? Don't worry!! Mount Si Lacrosse has sticks to use for those who do not have their own.

Click HERETo Register for the Fall Clinics!

 

**REGISTRATION RALLY**

The 2014 Lacrosse Season Registration rally will be held November 10, 2013from 10:00am through 2pm this year at Mount Si High School. The event will take place in the commons area. On the menu will be pulled pork sandwiches, chips and a beverage for $5. This is an excellent time to meet with coaches and other lacrosse families, check out the new spirit wear, and get your questions answered. For those attending the registration rally and registering for the 2014 season, a free Lacrosse tee shirt will be given.
  • Early Bird Registrationfor the regular season all levels will open on Sunday, November 3rd, 2013. Early bird discounts end at 11:59 pm on Sunday, November 10th, 2013. Early registrants will receive $15 off the regular price.
  • Regular Registrationcontinues from November 10th through 11:59 pm on Sunday, January 12th, 2014.
  • Late Registrationruns from January 13, 2014 to February 16, 2014. The Late registration fee is $35.
Scholarshipinformation can be obtained by email toadmin@mountsilacrosse.org. For additional registration questions please the Registration FAQ page via the drop menu under the Register tab.

item.title: Registration for Spring 2014
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded:
Registration for the Spring 2014 season is well underway!
  • TheRegistration Rally was a big hit! Thank you to those who came out for the rally and our free clinics!
  • You still have time to register! Regular Registrationcontinues from November 11th through 11:59 pm on Sunday, January 12th, 2014. Don't wait until the last minute to register!
  • Late Registrationwill run from January 13, 2014 to February 16, 2014. The Late registration fee is $35.
  • Our club offers a payment plan and a family discount. If you have 3 or more children to register, you will receive a discount which will be refunded to you after registration.
The Mount Si Lacrosse Club offers Scholarships! If you are interested in scholarship information, please send an email to our confidential mailbox atadmin@mountsilacrosse.org. For additional registration questions please see the Registration FAQ page via the drop menu under the Register tab.

item.title: Winter Speed Camps and Lacrosse Registration
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded:
The schedule for the Mount Si Winter Speed Camps is set! It is open to students in grades 6th - 12th. Registration is at Winter Speed and Agility Camp. This is a clinic that will help athletes work on strength and conditioning to prepare for the the lacrosse season.
Have you registered for the 2014 Lacrosse Season! We are busy planning for it and meetings are scheduled for some levels. If your son or daughter is interested in playing, please register via the Mount Si Lacrosse website as soon as you can. Registering early helps the club plan for the number of teams and coaches.
  • Regular Registrationcontinues through 11:59 pm on Sunday, January 12th, 2014. Dont wait until the last minute to register!
  • Late Registrationwill run from January 13, 2014 to February 16, 2014. The Late registration fee is $35.
  • Our club offers a payment plan and a family discount. If you have 3 or more children to register, you will receive a discount that will be refunded to you after you've registered.
Mount Si Lacrosse Club offers Scholarships! If you are interested in scholarship information, please send an email to our confidential mailbox atadmin@mountsilacrosse.org. For additional registration questions, please see the Registration FAQ page via the drop menu under the Register tab.

item.title: Girls and Boys Playing Off Season Lacrosse with the Seattle Starz
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Mount Si's Jessica Morris and Chaija Olsson who played in the Sandstorm LAX Tourney in Indio CA this past weekend! Jessica played for the Starz 7/8 team in the tournament and they placed 2nd in their division and tied for 3rd overall. She will be a 7th grader on our 7/8 team this year...we are looking forward to another great season from Jessica! Chaija played for the 2017 Starz High School team in the tournament. She played on our Mount Si 7/8 team last year and was an incredible asset both offensively and defensively. We will miss her but look forward to watching her grow her lacrosse career in high school this year! Great job girls! Congratulations also goes out to Mount Si's Tyler Smith and the Seattle Starz Elite 2015 team! This team traveled to San Diego in early January to compete in the Adrenaline Challenge against 25 teams including top ranked and historically competitive clubs such as the OC Kings and NorCal. The Starz went undefeated over the weekend and took the championship with a strong defensive shutout giving them a 7-0 win. It's great to see lacrosse grow and have strong representation from the Seattle area! In addition, Mt Si 7th graders, Ben Luke and Parker Fritz, who play on the Seattle Starz U13 Elite team had a strong showing at the same tournament. They came in 2nd place going 4 - 0 in their division and losing by 1 point against the RC Starz in the championship game. 2015 Champs U13 Elite Team

wp:comment.wp:comment_author: Joe
wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Joey Grzetic was also on the 5/6/7 select Seattle Starz

item.title: Spirit Wear
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded:
WE ARE NOW TAKING ORDERS FOR LACROSSE SPIRIT WEAR!

Cut off date for this round isFebruary 7th. All orders placed before this time will be delivered by the beginning of the season. Under the Gear tab, click on SPIRIT WEAR. A few items:
  • All custom orders are final.
  • If you want/need to confirm a size, you can stop by Workhorse Sports in Preston to try on your garment.
For those players needing helmets, bags (boys and girls), cute headbands, High School practice jersey, umbrella's or cool lacrosse socksclick on the TEAM STORE and place your order.

item.title: Custom Made Mouth Guards!
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded: Mount Si Lacrosse players have a great opportunity to purchase *custom* mouth guards for a significantly low price. The mouth guard will be custom fitted for your son or daughter by Kirby Nelson Orthodontics. They regularly sell for $250, players can purchase them for $75.00! Kirby Nelson will open his office specifically for us on Saturday February 1st from 9 am to noon. They will do an "assembly line" for impressions in order to reduce and wait time. Here's what we need you to do to take advantage of this reduced rate. Send an email to Kristi Wood at: kristiwood1@gmail.com. Please include the following information: Players name, Parents full name and time you expect to drop by. Kristi will let Kirby Nelson know to expect you and they will have a consent form ready for you to sign. It's important that we know you plan on coming so Kirby Nelson can have the consent form ready for each parent to sign and so Kirby Nelson can make sure to have enough staff on hand. They will also be collecting $75.00 (cash/check/credit) payment at the time of the impression. Hurry - don't miss out on this great opportunity! RSVP deadline is Friday, January 31st!

item.title: Registration is in the final stretch!
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded: Registration for the 2014 Spring Lacrosse season is still open. Registration runs through February 16th. If you haven't registered, you still have time. There is a Late Registration fee of $35 for registrations between Jan 13th to Feb 16th. As a reminder, our club offers a payment plan and a family discount. If you have 3 or more children to register, you will receive a discount that will be refunded to you after youve registered. Mount Si Lacrosse Club offers Scholarships! If you are interested in scholarship information, please send an email to our confidential mailbox at admin@mountsilacrosse.org. For additional registration questions, please click here.

item.title: Scorekeeping, Stats & Timer Clinic
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded:
We've scheduled a Scorekeeping/Stats & Timer class for all parents who want to learn how to keep stats and time during lacrosse games. Ideally we'd have at least 2-4 parents per team willing to do this each game. We have 12 spots open for our initial class.
The stats/timer clinic set for Tuesday, March 4th, 7:00pm at the TPC Boardroom.
If you'd like to sign up, please email Sarah Burns at ssburnsy5@gmail.com.

item.title: Spirit Wear - Last Chance to order for the Season
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded: LAST round of spirit wear for this season is happening now. Get your final orders in by March 17th for an early April delivery. Check out available items under the Gear tab and then Spirit Wear. Please note that the performance hoodie is on back order till mid-April. We will still take orders for this item, but you will not receive the hoodie till the end of April.

The Team Storeis always open.....

item.title: Thank you from the MSLC!
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded: Thank you MSLC Family! Wow what an amazing night! With your very generous giving, our event raised more than $82,000! This much needed money will help the Mount Si Lacrosse Clubs overall cost of operations, coach and player development, player scholarships and our fielding needs! On behalf of the MSLC Board of Directors, I would like to give a huge thanks to the following amazing volunteers, without whom we would not have been so successful! Thank you to our very own MSLC players! Mount Si High JV players: Johnathan Haycock, Kade McNamara, Seth Howard, Anders Howard, Kota Bethell, Jason Chapman, Collin Crose, Ryan Ploof and Connor Ross! Mount Si High Varsity Players: Nicky Yotz, Bryce Abbott, Henry Dunn and Riley Wood! Emily Wood and Max Williamson (one of our JV Coaches)! Jessica Morris (LAX Girl Power)!!! Char Yotz (my other half in this. It would not have happened without you!), Corey Mosley, Theresa Johns, Michelle Virta, Eileen Crose, Chantal Blankenburg, Tim and Cheri Buell, Heather Vincent, Keely Weidenbach, Darci Schwartzenberger, Stacy Crow, Sophie Harris, Sharmon Morris, Susan Husa, Kendy Sasaki-Ross, Tina Townsley, Laurie Haycock, Eric Mahler and Sarah Burns! Our pictures from the evening were graciously taken for us by Eric Mahler. As soon as I have them available, I will post them on Facebook. A huge thanks toChurch of the Ridgefor donating their gorgeous space. Thank you to Darrin and Michelle Maddux for donating the wine and rum! Thank you to Ram Restaurant for donating beer! These sponsors paid for the cost of the evening: Snoqualmie Cattle Company,Finaghtys Irish Pub,Workhorse Lax,Sigillo Cellars, Sandra LaHaye,Cascade Mountain Tech, Richard and Connie DelMissier. Thank you, because of these generous donations, everything raise during the auction itself went straight to MSLC! Thank you,   Kristi Wood MSLC Fundraising Chair

item.title: Summer Ball for High School Players
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded: High school summer ball starts Tuesday June 3rd. It's not too late to register to play. All incoming freshman are welcome to participate Click on the Register tab to sign up for Summer League. Practice is every Tuesday night from6-8pm, games every Wednesday between 5-9pm.   For schedule and information, please see the HS Boys Page and click on Summer Lacrosse 2014.
